Colin Green wrote:

>Kenneth Stanley wrote:
>
>  
>
>>You mentioned your imperfect results and I was thinking
>>this may be due to your style of evaluation as opposed to your NEAT
>>implementation.  For example, do you start each trial from a random
>>position (either the prey or the predator)?  Or is something
>>randomized about the prey? 
>>
>>    
>>
A quick update on the prey capture work. I've been fine tuning the prey 
capture test cases and I do now have some nice results, particularly 
evolved agent's that are able to remember where the prey was last seen 
before it moved out of sensor range - and then move in that direction. I 
still need to extend the new tests further - to evolve agents that can 
chase moving prey - following that and some code tidying up I'll put the 
new code on the web site and post another message.

Regards,

Colin.
